Detailed Description

Special Renderable class that compensates for the ability of SceneNodes to only have one Component.

Author:
Jack Owen Shelton Framework used in both my CS 3520 and CS 4322 projects.
Date:
Spring 2009 This is a conveniance class. This class fills the role of decorator.

CompoundRenderable::~CompoundRenderable (  ) 

Deconstructor.

Remarks:
This will not destroy any attached Renderables, but the will be notified of their removal.

Definition at line 70 of file CompoundRenderable.h.

void CompoundRenderable::notifyRemoved ( SceneNode *  node  )  [virtual]

Notify the CompoundRenderable that it has been removed from a SceneNode.

This method has been overriden in order for the CompoundRenderable to be able to notify its attached Renderables.

Parameters:
node The SceneNode that the CompoundRenderable has been removed from.
See also:
Component::notifyRemoved(SceneNode* node)

Reimplemented from Component.

Definition at line 51 of file CompoundRenderable.cpp.

void CompoundRenderable::registerUser ( SceneNode *  node  )  [virtual]

Overriden from Component.

Needed to be overriden in order for the CompoundRenderable to be able to register the attached Renderables.

Parameters:
node The SceneNode to be registered.
See also:
Component::registerUser(SceneNode* node)

Reimplemented from Component.

Definition at line 24 of file CompoundRenderable.cpp.

void CompoundRenderable::removeAllUsers (  )  [virtual]

Removes the Component from all of the SceneNodes that use it.

Needed to be overriden in order for the CompoundRenderable to be able to call the method on all attached Renderables.

See also:
Component::removeAllUsers()

Reimplemented from Component.

Definition at line 75 of file CompoundRenderable.cpp.

void CompoundRenderable::render ( SceneNode *const   node,
const hgeVector &  screenPosition,
Camera *const   cam 
) [inline, virtual]

Core render method.

The other render methods call this method once it has been determined that the object should be rendered. This is the Template method, and doesn't do anything in this class.

Parameters:
node The node whose position, rotation, and scale are going to be used to render the object.
screenPosition The position to render the object at transformed into screen space.

Implements Renderable.
